prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Will Powers
Description: The defendant. Action star who plays the title role in "The Steel Samurai" TV Show.
Character 4
Name: Security Lady
Description: Security guard at Global Studios. Claims she saw Powers heading to the scene.
Character 5
Name: Jack Hammer
Description: The victim. A former big name action star. Played the role of the Evil Magistrate.
Character 6
Name: Assistant
Description: Name: Penny Nichols. Assistant at Global Studios in charge of large props and set pieces.
Character 7
Name: The Director
Description: Name: Sal Manella. Creator of "The Steel Samurai." Present on the day of the crime.
Character 8
Name: Cody Hackins
Description: A big fan of the Steel Samurai. Present at the studio on the day of the crime.
Character 9
Name: Dee Vasquez
Description: High-ranking producer at Global Studios. Present on the day of the crime.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Powers's Letter
Description: Document proving Will Powers's request for an attorney.
Evidence 2
Name: Guidemap
Description: Guidemap to Global Studios. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Jack's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/15 at 2:30 PM. Cause: Pierced through the chest by a spear.
Evidence 4
Name: Cardkey
Description: Cardkey for Studio Employees. Grants access into Studio One.
Evidence 5
Name: Powers'(?) Photo
Description: Taken at the gate between the entrance and the Studios. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2] [caption] Steel Samurai is seen walking. He's dragging one leg. Click here for details. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2]
Will:
No, it's okay. This is the real me. When I got the part of the Steel Samurai, with that mask...
Evidence 6
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: This spear was found stuck in the chest of the victim. The murder weapon. A break in the shaft has been mended with duct tape.
Evidence 7
Name: Empty Bottle → Sleeping Pill Bottle
Description: Found on a table in the employee area. The label reads "Sleeping Pills." Found on a table in the employee area. Bears Jack Hammer's fingerprints.
Evidence 8
Name: Trailer Key
Description: The key tag reads "Studio Two Trailer".
Evidence 9
Name: Vasquez's Memo
Description: The memo read "Bring me the script from Episode 13".
Evidence 10
Name: Script
Description: A Steel Samurai script. The cover reads "Episode 13".
Evidence 11
Name: Mr. Monkey's Head
Description: Blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM.
Evidence 12
Name: Steel Samurai Card
Description: A trading card. Apparently, these are really popular with kids these days.
Evidence 13
Name: URP Card
Description: An "Ultra Rare Premium" Steel Samurai collectible card. Very valuable.
Evidence 14
Name: "Path to Glory"
Description: Contains photos of every victory scene in every battle the Steel Samurai has won.
Evidence 15
Name: Cody's Camera
Description: A new digital camera. Cody always carries it, though he's still learning how to use it.
Evidence 16
Name: Steak Plate
Description: Found in the employee area. On it are traces of sleeping pills and a large bone.
Evidence 17
Name: Five-Year-Old Photo
Description: Shows an accident involving Jack Hammer. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Van
Description: Manella used this van to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting in the trailer.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: On the day of the murder, I arrived at the guard station at 1:00 PM.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 1
Testimony: Poor old Hammer and the rest had been doing a run-through there since the morning.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 2
Testimony: I, well, I had some errands to run that morning.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 3
Testimony: Anyway, it was 1:00 when I got to the guard station.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 4
Testimony: I was at the main gate from then until 5:00!
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 5
Testimony: Now, the murder happened at 2:30 PM, right?
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 6
Testimony: Interesting to me, because a certain man walked right by me at 2:00 PM.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 7
Testimony: It was Powers! That man right there, and he was heading toward the studio!
Person: Oldbag

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. So, I'm looking at the evidence list and the testimonies provided. 

First, I'll go through the evidence one by one to understand what each piece of evidence is. 

Evidence 0: Attorney's Badge - This is just Mia's badge, probably to establish her as a defense attorney, but it doesn't seem to directly relate to the crime.

Evidence 1: Powers's Letter - This is a document proving Will Powers's request for an attorney. So, it's related to his legal situation but not directly connected to the murder.

Evidence 2: Guidemap - A map of Global Studios, which might be relevant for the location of the crime.

Evidence 3: Jack's Autopsy Report - Details the time and cause of Jack Hammer's death, which is crucial for the timeline.

Evidence 4: Cardkey - Access to Studio One, which could be important for who had access to the area where the murder happened.

Evidence 5: Powers'(?) Photo - A photo taken at the gate showing Will Powers walking, dragging one leg. This seems relevant because it shows Powers was at the studio around the time of the murder.

Evidence 6: Samurai Spear - The murder weapon found in Jack's chest. This is a key piece of evidence linking Powers to the murder.

Evidence 7: Empty Bottle - Found with Jack's fingerprints, possibly indicating he was there.

Evidence 8: Trailer Key - A key to a trailer, which might be relevant for access to specific areas.

Evidence 9: Vasquez's Memo - A memo from a high-ranking producer, possibly indicating some inside knowledge or involvement.

Evidence 10: Script - A script from an episode, might be a red herring or related to the plot.

Evidence 11: Mr. Monkey's Head - Blocked the path between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM, which could be a time window for the crime.

Evidence 12: Steel Samurai Card - A collectible card, probably not directly related to the murder.

Evidence 13: URP Card - A valuable card, might be a distraction or related to the suspect's actions.

Evidence 14: "Path to Glory" - A collection of victory scenes, possibly a motive for the murder if Jack was involved in its production.

Evidence 15: Cody's Camera - A camera that might have evidence, but it's unclear if it was used or found.

Evidence 16: Steak Plate - Found with sleeping pills and a bone, possibly indicating a meal or a cover-up.

Evidence 17: Five-Year-Old Photo - A photo of an accident involving Jack, possibly showing a pattern of violence.

Evidence 18: Van - Used to transport someone after a meeting, might be related to the suspects.

Now, looking at the testimonies:

Testimony 0: The old bag testified about the timeline, mentioning that he saw Powers at 2:00 PM heading toward the studio, and the murder happened at 2:30 PM.

Testimony 1: He mentioned that the murder happened during a run-through, which might be a cover story.

Testimony 2: He had errands and was at the guard station from 1:00 PM to 5:00 PM.

Testimony 3: He was at the main gate until 5:00 PM.

Testimony 4: The murder happened at 2:30 PM, and he saw Powers at 2:00 PM.

Testimony 5: He saw Powers at 2:00 PM, and Powers was heading toward the studio.

Testimony 6: He saw Powers at 2:00 PM, and Powers was dragging one leg.

So, the key points from the testimonies are that Powers was seen at the gate at 2:00 PM, heading toward the studio, and the murder happened at 2:30 PM. This would mean that Powers had time to commit the murder.

Now, looking at the evidence, the Samurai Spear (Evidence 6) was the murder weapon. The Empty Bottle (Evidence 7) had Jack's fingerprints. The Photo (Evidence 5) shows Powers at 2:00 PM, dragging one leg, which might indicate he was injured or under stress, possibly after the murder.

However, the key contradiction seems to be with the timing. The testimonies suggest that Powers was at the gate at 2:00 PM, heading toward the studio, and the murder occurred at 2:30 PM. This would mean that Powers had enough time to commit the murder. However, the Empty Bottle (Evidence 7) was found on a table in the employee area with Jack's fingerprints, suggesting that Jack was there, possibly alive, after 2:30 PM.

Wait, that doesn't make sense because Jack was the victim, so if he was already dead, his fingerprints wouldn't be on the bottle after 2:30 PM. Therefore, the Empty Bottle with Jack's fingerprints suggests that he was alive after the murder, which contradicts the timeline from the testimonies.

Alternatively, maybe the Empty Bottle was found near the body, but that's not clear. Or perhaps the fingerprints were from before the murder. But the testimonies suggest that the murder happened at 2:30 PM, and the Empty Bottle was found in the employee area, possibly after the murder, indicating that Jack was still alive.

Therefore, the Empty Bottle with Jack's fingerprints contradicts the testimonies about the timeline of events.
</think>

cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's see, the characters involved are Maya Fey, Miles Edgeworth, Dick Gumshoe, Will Powers, the Security Lady, Jack Hammer, Penny Nichols, Sal Manella, Cody Hackins, and Dee Vasquez. 

First, I need to look at the evidences and testimonies provided. The evidence includes things like the Attorney's Badge, Powers's Letter, Guidemap, Jack's Autopsy Report, Cardkey, a photo of Powers, the Samurai Spear, an Empty Bottle with sleeping pills, a Trailer Key, Vasquez's Memo, a Script, Mr. Monkey's Head, Steel Samurai Cards, URP Cards, "Path to Glory," Cody's Camera, a Steak Plate, a Five-Year-Old Photo, and a Van used by Manella.

The testimonies are from the Oldbag, who was at the guard station and saw Will Powers heading towards the studio around 2:00 PM, while the murder happened at 2:30 PM. The Oldbag also mentions that no one else went to the studio before then except Powers.

Now, looking at the evidence, the Samurai Spear was found stuck in Jack Hammer's chest, making it the murder weapon. The Empty Bottle with sleeping pills and Jack's fingerprints were also found. There's a photo taken at 2:00 PM showing Powers dragging a leg, which suggests he was injured or in a hurry. The Autopsy Report confirms that Jack died at 2:30 PM from a spear wound.

So, the testimony says that Powers was the only one who went to the studio before the murder, while the photo evidence shows Powers was at the gate at 2:00 PM. That aligns with the timeline because the murder happened 30 minutes later. However, the Empty Bottle with sleeping pills and the Steak Plate suggest that Jack had taken some sleeping pills, possibly to knock him out before the attack. But the photo doesn't show any signs of that, so maybe the time is off or there's a discrepancy in the timeline.

Wait, the Empty Bottle and Steak Plate have sleeping pills, but the photo was taken at 2:00 PM, and the murder was at 2:30 PM. So, if Jack took the pills at 2:00 PM, he would have been knocked out by 2:30 PM, which matches the autopsy time. But the photo shows Powers walking by at 2:00 PM, which is consistent with the timeline. So, the testimony and evidence actually support each other, showing that Powers was the one who delivered the fatal blow after drugging Jack.

Hmm, but the user is asking for evidence that contradicts testimony. Maybe I'm missing something. Perhaps the time of the photo doesn't align with the time of the sleeping pills. If the sleeping pills were taken later, or if there's another inconsistency, that could cause a contradiction. Alternatively, maybe the presence of the Steak Plate with bone fragments indicates that Jack was hit after the pills took effect, which aligns with the timeline. So, the evidence supports the testimony.

Wait, the Empty Bottle was found in the employee area, but the photo was taken at the gate. So, maybe the sleeping pills were taken earlier, and the photo was taken after. That would mean the pills were already in his system by 2:00 PM, making the murder at 2:30 PM possible. So, the evidence supports the testimony.

I'm not seeing a direct contradiction here. Maybe I need to look elsewhere. The Guidemap and Cardkey indicate that Powers had access to Studio One, which aligns with the photo showing him heading towards the studio. The Script and Vasquez's Memo about Episode 13 might relate to the motive, but that's not directly conflicting with the testimony.

The Samurai Spear being the murder weapon matches the Autopsy Report. The Mr. Monkey's Head blocked the path between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM, which could mean that the area was secure after the murder, but that doesn't contradict the timeline either.

So, perhaps the testimonies and evidence are consistent, and there's no direct contradiction. But the user is asking for one pair that contradicts, so maybe I need to consider that the Empty Bottle and Steak Plate suggest premeditation, while the photo shows Powers was in a hurry, which could indicate he was acting on impulse, contradicting the premeditation. But that's more of a narrative conflict rather than direct evidence.

Alternatively, if the photo was taken after the murder, that would be a problem, but it's stated as 2:00 PM, which is before the murder. So, I think the main evidence supports the testimony without direct contradiction.
</think>
